projects.name: CAP LIMA
projects.subtitle: Competition
projects.description:
RENOVATION FOR DOCUMENTARY CENTER OF ARCHITECTURE
Team: 
Alexander Auris 
Leonie Van Bellingem
--- 
The project explores the role of Peruvian architecture in the 
contemporary social context and how this can be introduced to 
an existing building designed 76 years ago. The CAP building 
is located on Tacna av. In this project, the architect Enrique 
Seoane, reflected on the cultural layers of Peruvian culture and 
its representation in architecture. Following this interest, our 
intervention is understood as the introduction of a new layer 
that represents the role of architecture today.
We understand contemporary architectural design in the 
Peruvian context as a tool for social inclusion, gathering 
and transmission of knowledge, and that it must recover the 
perception of citizenship in architecture as a necessary discipline 
for the socio-cultural development of the country. This way of 
seeing the architectural, together with the program proposed 
for the contest, allows this building to become a new benchmark 
for inclusion and architectural culture. For this, three strategies 
are proposed that allow flexibility, accessibility and at the same 
time maintain the spatial characteristics of the building.
